business.headline: Northern Arc Capital IPO allotment tomorrow: Check latest subscription, GMPNorthern Arc Capital Limited, founded in 2009, provides retail loans to underserved households and businesses across India.

Sensex, Nifty end higher after US Fed's 50 bps rate cut; NTPC gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 236.57 points higher at 83,184.80, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 38.25 points higher at 25,415.80. Both the indices had hit fresh all-time highs in early trade.
Government working on new income tax act. Check inside detailsThe new tax framework aims to replace the current 1961 act, simplifying the tax process for individuals and businesses.

RPSG's Firstsource expands globally, eyes $550 million boost from AIThe expansion is part of Firstsource's strategy to improve its business margins while continuing to create jobs in India. For every position created in Australia, the company plans to create three jobs in India.

Gold prices react to US Fed rate cut: What investors need to knowThe US Federal Reserve's rate cuts aim to stabilise the economy but raise concerns about their impact on global markets, particularly on gold prices, a key investment in uncertain times.

Explained: Why small and midcap stocks are under pressure todayPublic Sector Undertaking (PSU) stocks, particularly in sectors such as defence, railways, and non-banking financial companies (NBFCs), have been hit hard.
IT, banking, large-cap stocks: Strategies to boost portfolio after Fed rate cutWill the US Fed's rate cut boost opportunities on Dalal Street? Check these expert strategies to realign your portfolio.

HAL, IRFC, BHEL stocks fall: Here's why PSU stocks are under pressurePSU stocks fell even as India's benchmark indices, Sensex and Nifty, rose on the back of higher-than-expected interest rate cuts by the US Federal Reserve.

Explained: What US Fed's 50 bps rate cut means for Indian economyThe Fed's decision signalled a shift towards easing monetary policy, with experts divided on its implications for the global economy, including India. Here's a detailed look at how the bigger-than-expected rate cut could impact the Indian economy and the broader market.
Cisco cuts thousands of jobs in second biggest layoff of 2024: Report This latest round of layoffs follows a previous cut in February when Cisco let go of about 4,000 employees.

US Fed cuts rates by 50 bps: How will it affect Indian stock market?This is the first time the Fed has reduced rates since 2020, and it has been done to address slowing economic growth and easing inflation in the US.

Sensex jumps over 700 points, Nifty crosses 25,500 for 1st time; IT stocks gainThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 758.7 points at 83,706.93 at 9:41 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 215.40 points to trade at 25,592.95.

US Fed slashes rates by 50 bps in first rate reduction since 2020Policymakers see the Fed's benchmark rate falling by another half of a percentage point by the end of this year, another full percentage point in 2025, and by a final half of a percentage point in 2026 to end in a 2.75 per cent-3.00 per cent range.
US Fed rate decision today at 11:30 pm – 5 things to watch outMarkets are widely expecting a 25-basis-point cut in the key interest rate, marking the first reduction in four years.

Tupperware, once a household name, files for bankruptcyTupperware Brands and some of its subsidiaries filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection on Tuesday. The company, widely known for its food storage containers, has been struggling with falling sales in recent years.

NPS Vatsalya: How to invest, eligibility criteria, and online buying guideNPS Vatsalya enables parents or guardians to open a pension account for minors and contribute as little as Rs 1,000 annually, making it accessible to families from various economic backgrounds.

Explained: Why IT stocks faced profit booking ahead of US Fed rate decisionMphasiS led the decline, dropping 5.6%, followed by L&T Technology Services, Persistent Systems, Tata Consultancy Services, HCL Technologies, and Tech Mahindra, which saw losses ranging from 3% to 4%.
Sensex, Nifty fall amid profit booking in IT stocks; TCS falls 4%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 131.43 points down at 82,948.23, whille the NSE Nifty50 lost 41 points to end at 25,377.55.

Reliance Infra shares hit 20% upper circuit. What's next? The sharp uptick in Reliance Infra's share price followed the company's announcement of a significant reduction in its standalone external debt, from Rs 3,831 crore to Rs 475 crore.
Paytm shares cross Rs 700 for the first time since January. More room to rise?	Before today, the last time Paytm traded above Rs 700 was in late January, closing at Rs 761.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Israel didn't just rig Hezbollah pagers, it actually made those explosive pagersAfter thousands of pagers of Hezbollah fighters exploded in Lebanon, it was believed that Israel had somehow penetrated the supply chain and rigged the devices with explosives. However, jaw-dropping reports now suggest that Israel might have created shell companies that actually manufactured those explosive pagers for Hezbollah. Here's how it managed the unthinkable.

India reacts after US court summons government in plot to murder Gurpatwant PannunThe US District Court for Southern District of New York named the Government of India, National Security Advisor Ajit Doval, former R&AW chief Samant Goel, in the summons.

Pakistan going 'balle-balle' over Congress-National Conference manifesto: PMPM Modi said while nobody is giving the Congress and National Conference any importance in Jammu and Kashmir, "Pakistan main inki balle balle ho rahi hai" (they are being celebrated in Pakistan.

Government probing EY India employee's death due to 'excessive workload'The incident has led to a massive outrage on social media after a letter written by the Pune woman's mother to the head of Ernst & Young India went viral.

On a strange Chennai day, Ashwin and Jadeja lead a familiar rescue actIndia vs Bangladesh, 1st Test: R Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja led a familiar rescue act for India, stitching an unbeaten 195-run partnership on Thursday. Bangladesh dominated the first half of a strangely overcast day in Chennai, but Inida fought back to take control.

Congress heir went to US, said our 'devi-devta' are not God: PM jabs Rahul GandhiAddressing an election rally in Jammu, PM Modi said that Rahul Gandhi and the Congress can put faith and culture at stake for a few votes anytime.

How recent losses predict a Trudeau grand exitThe party of Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau recently lost the byelection in Montreal, a safe seat. Seen together with the defeat in Toronto, another Liberal Party fortress, in June, and his plunging approval ratings, it could be a marker for Trudeau's grand exit in 2025.
IND vs BAN: R Ashwin haunts Bangladesh again with 6th Test hundred in ChennaiR Ashwin has come to haunt Bangladesh once again as he scored his 6th Test hundred on Thursday, September 19.

Can Kejriwal take AAP unity for granted?Politics is what takes place between what's said and what's left unsaid. Most AAP leaders said that Kejriwal would return after the election, and that's exactly why they have agreed to Atishi as the CM. What's unsaid is that Atishi is a stop-gap solution. But will AAP unity stand the test if Atishi continues as the CM? Will personal ambitions create a fissure within the ranks?
Woman's body chopped up, found stuffed inside suitcase lying on Chennai roadThe Chennai Police detained a man after they found a woman's dismembered body in a suitcase, 100 metres away from his home.

Employee blames rats for hole in Delhi-Mumbai highway, company fires himThe firm stated that the comment was made by a junior employee who had no technical understanding regarding the project and confirmed that he had been terminated from the company.

PM has many meetings, can't confirm specifics: India on Modi-Trump US meetPM Modi is scheduled to visit the US on a three-day trip to attend the sixth Quad Summit being held on September 21. The summit was initially supposed to be hosted by India, but the venue was moved at the US's request.

So you think this is crispy fried chicken? Viral video will give you a big surpriseThis video of 'crispy fried chicken' has gone viral with over 11 million views. Watch it because you are in for a big surprise.

Communal tension in Telangana over erection of flags, police use lathichargeThe incident took place when a group of men, belonging to the Muslim community, erected a green flag at the site, which was later removed and discarded onto the road by members of the Hindu community.

Over 3,600 chemicals from food packaging found in human bodiesAround 100 of these chemicals are considered to be of "high concern" to human health, said lead study author Birgit Geueke from the Food Packaging Forum Foundation, a Zurich-based NGO.

Contempt petition by Jharkhand catches Attorney General off guard in Supreme CourtThe petition accused the government of delaying the appointment of the Jharkhand High Court's Chief Justice. The Attorney General, in response, claimed to be unaware of the matter.

SRK promised to take care of my son, not able to contact him: Actor VijaytaLate music composer Aadesh Shrivastava's wife and former actor Vijayta Pandit recently spoke about her husband's last days. She said that Shah Rukh Khan had promised to help their son during tough times.

As parties go big on women-centric schemes to woo voters, here is a status checkIn its poll manifestos for Haryana, Congress has promised to give a monthly allowance of Rs 2,000 to every woman aged between 18 and 60 years and the BJP has vowed to provide Rs 2,100 per month to women under the Lado Lakshmi Yojana.

How Udhayanidhi Stalin used Sanatana Dharma as crutches to climb Udhayanidhi Stalin is poised to become the deputy chief minister of Tamil Nadu. A year earlier, he made critical remarks on Sanatana Dharma, which a section of experts believed would thwart his growth. However, the remarks helped him solidify his standing within the DMK and settle the succession battle.

Congress, Uddhav Sena in tussle over 6 minority-dominated seats in MumbaiThe Congress is eyeing the minority-dominated seats in Mumbai to regain its traditional vote bank that is gradually shifting to the Uddhav Sena.

The evolution of maps: From 500 BC to the modern ageThe world map we know today owes its shape to the daring exploits of explorers who ventured into uncharted territories, forever pushing the limits of the known world. Intrepid figures like Christopher Columbus and Marco Polo shattered the myths of unreachable lands, offering a new understanding of global geography. Here's how maps have evolved through the ages.

Indian ammunition enters Ukraine despite Russian opposition: ReportThe transfer of arms and ammunition to support Ukraine's defence against Russia has occurred for more than a year. The Kremlin also reportedly raised the issue with India on at least two occasions.

Mukesh Ahlawat new face in Atishi cabinet, Kailash Gahlot to be retained: SourcesMukesh Ahlawat contested the 2020 Delhi Assembly elections from Sultanpur Majra on an AAP ticket. He won the polls with 48,042 votes and replaced Sandeep Kumar, former minister for the welfare of Scheduled castes.

JP Nadda's 'failed product' barb at Rahul Gandhi in letter to Mallikarjun KhargeJP Nadda's letter to Mallikarjun Kharge came two days after the latter wrote to the Prime Minister raising concerns over "extremely objectionable, violent and rude" remarks made by NDA leaders against Rahul Gandhi.

Ramayana The Legend of Prince Rama to re-release in theatres this OctoberThe anime adaptation of Valmiki's Ramayana will finally release in Indian theatres for the first time this October. The film will release in four languages - Hindi, English, Telugu and Tamil.

Vipul Shah's Hisaab to release in theatres despite huge OTT offerDirector Vipul Amrutlal Shah's upcoming film Hisaab, featuring Jaideep Ahlawat, Shefali Shah, and Abhishek Singh, is set for a theatrical release despite receiving a significant offer from OTT platforms.

Actor Jaideep Ahlawat joins The Family Man 3 cast: ReportThe versatile Jaideep Ahlawat has reportedly joined the cast of the highly-anticipated series, The Family Man Season 3. The show stars Manoj Bajpayee in the lead.

No Gain No Love spin-off drama poster released, to stream from OctoberA new poster has been released for Spice Up Our Love, the highly anticipated spin-off of No Gain No Love, starring Lee Sang-yi and Han Ji-hyun. The series will premiere on October 3 on Prime Video.

Shreyas Iyer fails again, out for his second duck in Duleep Trophy Duleep Trophy 2024: Shreyas Iyer's form woes continued in the ongoing season as he registered his second duck of the tournament during India D's third-round clash against India B.

Sumit Nagal issues clarification after AITA slams star for not playing Davis CupSumit Nagal has offered clarification as to why he decided to skip the Davis Cup after getting backlash from the All India Tennis Association (AITA) recently. Nagal reiterated his desire to play for the country in his lengthy statement.

Ben Stokes set to have scan on hamstring injury ahead of Pakistan tourEngland captain Ben Stokes is scheduled for a hamstring scan next week as the team evaluates his fitness for the upcoming Test series against Pakistan. The 33-year-old all-rounder has been sidelined since August due to the injury but remains active in training.

Gautam Gambhir disappointed after Rishabh Pant's dismissal in ChennaiIndia vs Bangladesh, 1st Test: Rishabh Pant threw away a good opportunity to convert a good start into a big knock. Guatam Gambhir echoed the emotions of the majority of Indian fans when Pant got out on 39 to young pacer Hasan Mahmud in Chennai on Thursday, September 19.

PSG boss Luis Enrique makes bizarre 'childbirth' analogy for Girona winPSG boss Luis Enrique claimed that his side's win over Girona in the Champions League was painful like childbirth. PSG secured a last-gasp win over Girona on Wednesday, September 18.

Kohli's dismissal makes Bangladesh analyst look like magician: Tamim IqbalIndia vs Bangladesh, Chennai Test: Former Bangladesh captain Tamim Iqbal said that Virat Kohli's dismissal on Day 1 made the Bangladeshi analyst look like a magician. Kohli was dismissed after scoring just six runs in the morning session.

Parthiv Patel reveals reasoning behind sending Rishabh Pant ahead of KL RahulFormer India cricketer Parthiv Patel gave the reasoning behind team management's decision to send Rishabh Pant ahead of KL Rahul on Day 1 of the first Test against Bangladesh in Chennai.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
